alert.note: Alert for Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Southeast Nicholas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 7:45AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A line of heavy showers will impact portions of Nicholas and northeastern Fayette Counties through 815 AM EDT... At 744 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of heavy showers near Summersville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Ansted, Craigsville, Calvin, Kesslers Cross Lanes, Canvas, Drennan, Nettie and Mount Nebo. This includes Route 19 between mile markers 23 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect. Heavy downpours could cause rapid rises in water. If rising water is observed, move to higher ground. Do not drive into areas covered by water.
